title: Personal requests to Yves Peters (Bald Condensed, Head Moderator Type ID Board)
content:
Moderating this board is lots of work — mostly behind the scenes — and eats up large amounts of my own time. Remember this is a voluntary job. I don’t get paid for this, and time spent here is time I can’t devote to my family, writing for Unzipped or Typographer.org or other websites, designing for my personal clients, rehearsing and gigging with my band Troubleman or — hey — _relaxing_.

I don’t mind doing this, make no mistake. Fact is, I even like it. But if you want a typeface identified or need advice or information, _please don’t send me a personal e-mail._ Post it here, that’s what this board is all about.

Thank you. ;^)

 [‹ (x) Ministry Of Sound logo - custom designed by Dalton Maag {Vince C}](http://web.archive.org/web/20081012174014/http:/typophile.com/node/30551 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Edgar Allan Poe "The Conqueror Worm" fine print - Monotype Baskerville {Yves} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081012174014/http:/typophile.com/node/30552 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Bald Condensed

comments.content: Oh, to avoid any misunderstandings: although I’d rather have you don’t e-mail me personally, I _will_ help you in person if and when I can. But on this board.

Yves, you might want to put a note in the How to Post or FAQ to this effect: not contacting moderators directly with questions about type IDs, but posting them to the list. Thanks for your generous efforts!
I’m planning to make a “10 tips how to survive the Type ID Board” mini-FAQ soon. ;^)

By the way. :) Thank you, Yves, for making all this _(The Type ID Board)_ even happen, work and run smoothly. This place would be nothing as close to what it is, without your effort and passion.

Dav

All those birthday emails?  
Congratulations :-)

R
I second that emotion, Yves. Go have five minutes with your family every month or so. ;-)

Ah Yves, still optimistic that people actually read the FAQ...

and yet still so many threads entitled: “help identifying a font”

thanks from me too.
